SECRET
G.T.5324
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 4th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) French Front. The enemy is continuing his retirement between REIMS and SOISSONS and the Allies have now reached the following line:- point on the AISNE CANAL 1500 metres North of COURCELLES (West of Reims) HILL 111 (West of CHAMPIGNY) - ROSNAY - SAPICOURT - BRANSCOURT - Main Road from JONCHERY - Southern outskirts of FISMES - then along the Southern bank of the River VESLE to CIRY - SERMOISE - VENIZEL. The French have crossed the AISNE at SOISSONS and have taken FAUBOURG ST. WAAST. Touch with the enemy rear guards is everywhere being maintained.
It is reported that the enemy is holding the high ground on the Northern banks of the VESLE and the AISNE in strength. North of MONTDIDIER the enemy has evacuated part of his front line between MESNIL ST GEORGE and MORISEL and is reported to have destroyed the bridges over the River AVRE at BRACHES and HARGIC0URT.
(b) British Front. No further details have been received regarding the withdrawal of the enemy in the ALBERT Sector but the British have cleared up the ground between the old front line and the ANCRE from DERNANCOURT to HAMEL. The position with regard to ALBERT is not yet known.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is no change in the general situation.
General Staff,
War Office S.W.1.
4th August 1918.
Issued at 12.45 p.m.
